entry.title: Three people found dead in RV from suspected overdoses
entry.summary: Tragedy struck at Shady Point RV Park, just south of Roseburg, where three individuals were found dead and one in medical distress from a suspected drug overdose.

entry.title: DINT INFORMATION ON DRUG OVERDOSE DEATHS
entry.summary: September 15, 4:50 p.m. The Douglas Interagency Narcotics Team has released information on drug overdose deaths which took place over the weekend. DINT Commander Lieutenant Rick McArthur said on Sunday, three individuals were found deceased in a recreational vehicle at the Shady Point RV Park, just south of Roseburg on Highway 99 South. McArthur said...

entry.summary: September 25, 2025 10:30 a.m. In the KQEN Cultural Spotlight: Rehearsals begin this week for the Umpqua Valley Youth Orchestra. entry.title: Bureau of Land Management plans trail maintenance day for Susan Creek Falls
entry.summary: Every Sept. 27, organizations across the country celebrate National Public Lands Day, a holiday dedicated to the conservation of public lands and the enrichment they bring to communities.

entry.title: Winston’s Now N Then Antique Mall Closing After 19 Years
entry.summary: Winston’s Now N Then Antique Mall may close Oct. 3 after 19 years unless an attorney can secure a lease extension. Specials include 50% off items marked 22 or 222. Vendors notified, showcases for sale, and a final parking lot sale may be held.

entry.title: 'Picasso at the Lapin Agile' continues at UACT
entry.summary: ROSEBURG — "Picasso at the Lapin Agile" continues through Sept. 24 at Umpqua Actors Community Theatre on West Harvard Avenue in Roseburg.

entry.title: Dancing in the street at the Umpqua Valley Farmer's Market
entry.summary: Corazón Oaxaqueño took over the center of the Umpqua Valley Farmers Market for more than an hour Saturday, performing three dances that each ran about 15 minutes and resembled short musicals. The routines included themes, plots and even a bullfight.

entry.title: What is bluegrass?
entry.summary: ELKTON — How to differentiate bluegrass music from country and folk?

entry.title: Outdoor living space a new addition to Showcase of Homes
entry.summary: There's not much room left on the hills above Roseburg's Hucrest neighborhood, but Kennaday Builders, LLC, was able to fit a new house between two others.

entry.title: TEMPERATURES ABOVE NORMAL STARTING TUESDAY IN THE UMPQUA VALLEY
entry.summary: September 15, 2025 4:00 a.m. The Umpqua Valley will see above normal temperatures for a few days beginning on Tuesday. Forecasters at the National Weather Service in Medford told News Radio 93-9 FM and 1240 KQEN that a strong ridge of high pressure will move in from California on Tuesday, impacting the entire Pacific Northwest....

entry.summary: September 15, 2025 3:50 a.m. The Douglas County Republican Party is hosting an event to honor the legacy of Charlie Kirk on Monday night. entry.summary: September 15, 2025 3:40 a.m. The City of Roseburg is taking applications from people interested in serving on a city commission. The planning and public works commissions have two vacancies each while the other commissions have one...

entry.title: BLM TIMBER SALES TO OFFER NEARLY 40 MILLION BOARD FEET
entry.summary: September 15, 2025 3:30 a.m. The Bureau of Land Management will offer six timber sales in September, totaling 39.7 million board feet to be harvested from 3,470 public acres across western Oregon, including in Douglas County. BLM Oregon/Washington State Director Barry Bushue said, “Timber harvested from public lands provides essential benefits to our nation, from...

entry.title: Coos Bay man gets 20 years for fatal drunk driving crash
entry.summary: The driver involved in a tragic bus crash that claimed the lives of a softball coach and player has been sentenced to more than 20 years in prison.

entry.title: DFPA TO BEGIN ISSUING PERMITS FOR PRESCRIBED PASTURE BURNS
entry.summary: September 12, 2025 11:00 a.m. The Douglas Forest Protective Association will begin issuing permits for prescribed pasture burns as conditions permit. Public Information Officer Rachel Pope said such prescribed burns may be performed on fields and pastures to foster productive grazing lands for livestock and to enhance wildlife habitats. Pope said the primary aim of...

entry.title: DFPA to Issue Prescribed Pasture Burn Permits, Backyard Debris Burns Still Restricted
entry.summary: DFPA will issue permits for prescribed pasture burns to improve grazing lands and reduce wildfire risk. Backyard debris burning remains closed. Learn more about prescribed fire: https://extension.oregonstate.edu/collection/prescribed-fire-basics

entry.title: Dowdy Sentenced to More Than 20 Years for Fatal Crash Involving UCC Softball Team
entry.summary: Johnathan James Dowdy, 33, of Coos Bay, was sentenced to 20 years and six months in prison for the April 18 crash that killed UCC softball player Kiley Jones and head coach Jami Strinz, and injured teammates. Victims and families shared emotional statements during sentencing.

entry.title: An apple for every meal
entry.summary: If you've been searching for a unique way to declare your love to that special someone, take a tip from the ancient Greeks.

entry.title: 'Reptiles are better than people': How Sutherlin's Ragin Reptiles Supply grew to a nationwide pet provider
entry.summary: SUTHERLIN — If there’s one thing Kalee Duncan wants people to know about reptiles, it’s that they’re far from the cold-hearted, emotionless creatures they’re often portrayed as in media.

entry.title: Glide Revitalization awarded $10,000 from Oregon Community Foundation
